intro: Cyphostemma andongense, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by elongated, woody fruits that contain pale yellow seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
